= | MedlinePlus = 003933 | OPS301 = | OtherCodes = | }} 'Lymph node biopsy' is a
test in which a lymph node or a piece of a lymph node is removed for examination
under a microscope (see: biopsy).

The lymphatic system is made up of several lymph nodes connected by lymph
vessels. The nodes produce white blood cells (lymphocytes) that fight
infections. When an infection is present, the lymph nodes swell, produce more
white blood cells, and attempt to trap the organisms that are causing the
infection. The lymph nodes also try to trap cancer cells.
